results.title: Effect of simvastatin in preventing progression of carotid artery stenosis.
results.text_hl: This finding indicates that treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ may reduce the risk for @DISEASE_Stroke @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with known @<m>DISEASE_Carotid_Artery_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002340 @@@carotid artery disease@@@.

citations.NLM: Hegland O, Dickstein K, Larsen JP. Effect of simvastatin in preventing progression of carotid artery stenosis. Am J Cardiol. 2001 Mar 1;87(5):643-5, A10. PMID: 11230855

results.title: Simvastatin attenuation of cerebral vasospasm after subarachnoid hemorrhage in rats via increased phosphorylation of Akt and endothelial nitric oxide synthase.
results.text_hl: High-dosage @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ prevented the reduction of @<m>DISEASE_Carotid_Artery_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002340 @@@ICA@@@ diameter and perimeter following @DISEASE_Subarachnoid_Hemorrhage @DISEASE_MESH:D013345 @@@SAH@@@, whereas both high and low dosages reduced wall thickness significantly at 24 and 72 hr.

citations.NLM: Sugawara T, Ayer R, Jadhav V, Chen W, Tsubokawa T, Zhang JH. Simvastatin attenuation of cerebral vasospasm after subarachnoid hemorrhage in rats via increased phosphorylation of Akt and endothelial nitric oxide synthase. J Neurosci Res. 2008 Dec;86(16):3635-43. PMID: 18683242

results.title: Macrophage infiltration, lectin-like oxidized-LDL receptor-1, and monocyte chemoattractant protein-1 are reduced by chronic HMG-CoA reductase inhibition.
results.text_hl: After 4 weeks of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ or vehicle treatment, or 2 weeks of vehicle and 2 weeks of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treatment, @<m>DISEASE_Carotid_Artery_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002340 @@@CCA@@@ was removed.

results.title: Simvastatin reduces neointimal thickening in low-density lipoprotein receptor-deficient mice after experimental angioplasty without changing plasma lipids.
results.text_hl: METHODS AND RESULTS: @<m>DISEASE_Carotid_Artery_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002340 @@@Carotid artery dilation@@@ (2.5 atm) and complete endothelial denudation were performed in male @CELLLINE_CVCL:C0MW @@@C57BL/6J@@@ @GENE_LDLR @GENE_16835 @@@LDLR@@@-/- @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ treated with low-dose (2 mg/kg) or high-dose (20 mg/kg) @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ or vehicle subcutaneously 72 hours before and then daily after injury.

citations.NLM: Chen Z, Fukutomi T, Zago AC, Ehlers R, Detmers PA, Wright SD, Rogers C, Simon DI. Simvastatin reduces neointimal thickening in low-density lipoprotein receptor-deficient mice after experimental angioplasty without changing plasma lipids. Circulation. 2002 Jul 2;106(1):20-3. PMID: 12093764
